sentences: From 10-14 August 2009, the AWG-LCA and AWG-KP held informal intersessional consultations in Bonn, Germany.
For the AWG-LCA, the focus was on how to proceed with the revised negotiating text ( FCCC/AWGLCA/2009/INF.1 ).
After a week of consultations, the AWG-LCA began to produce reading guides, tables, matrices and non-papers ( FCCC/AWGLCA/2009/INF.2 ) aimed at making the negotiating text more manageable.
Under the AWG-KP, discussions continued on Annex I parties emission reductions beyond the first commitment period ending in 2012.
In addition, parties resumed consideration of texts related to potential consequences and other issues in the AWG-KP s work programme.
The results of this work are reflected in revised documentation prepared by the Chair for Bangkok.

At the close of Bonn III, delegates in both AWGs seemed increasingly aware of the fact that the negotiating time remaining before Copenhagen is limited, and that important progress will be needed during the Bangkok meeting.
